result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Mary Schlichting is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:52 This includes 16CF128 and 15CF192  Defendant Melissa Mary Schlichting in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court will quash the warrants that were authoized this morning. Thorie - 16CF128 Plead to Ct 1 Poss of Meth, Ct 2 is to be dismissed,   15CF192 Ct 1 is to be dismissed.  Ct 2 dismiss but use for restitution.  14CF116 dismiss  Probation 2 yrs. Atty Nero agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  16CF128 Ct 1 Defendant pleads guilty.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 of 16CF128  Ct 2 is dismissed.  15CF192  Ct 1 and Ct 2 are dismissed but Ct 2 will be used for readin on restitution.   14CF116 is dismissed. Thorie requests 30 days to determine the amount or restitution. Court will allow 30 days to determine restitution. Court orders S/W Probation 2 years.  Cond: Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Comply with any conditions set by agent.

9:35  These cases are set for plea hearings.  This includes 15CF192 and 16CF128Attorney Adam Nero  in court.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is not present.  Thorie requests bench warrants in 16CT128, 15CF192 and 14CF116 Court orders bench warants in all 3 cases.

03:54 14CF116 and 15CF192 also at this time. Defendant Melissa Mary Schlichting in court, in custody  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Cert. Student Atty L. McMullen appears via phone with Liesl Nelson for the defendant.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie requests warrants to be quashed. Court quashes warrant on all three cases and reinstates bonds, 14CF116 $3000 reinstated, 15CF192 $3000 reinstated, 16CF128 $10,000 reinstated.  Set for plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 09:30 am.
